api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.API.html.title: Class API | FlexLib API Documentation
api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.API.html.summary: Class API Namespace Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib Assembly FlexLib.dll public class API Inheritance object API Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Fields RADIOLIST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS public const double RADIOLIST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS = 17 Field Value double Properties IsGUI Gets or sets a value indicating whether the program using this API is a GUI application. Set to true for GUI applications (WPF, WinForms), false for console or headless applications. public static bool IsGUI { get; set; } Property Value bool Examples // For a GUI application API.IsGUI = true; // For a console application API.IsGUI = false; Remarks This affects how the radio treats the client and may influence connection behavior. GUI clients are typically managed differently by the radio than non-GUI clients. ProgramName Gets or sets the name of the program that is using this API. This name is sent to the radio during connection and may be displayed by the radio or other clients. public static string ProgramName { get; set; } Property Value string Examples API.ProgramName = "MyFlexRadioApp"; Remarks This property must be set before calling Init(). RadioList Gets a list of all FlexRadio devices discovered on the network. public static List<Radio> RadioList { get; } Property Value List<Radio> Examples API.Init(); await Task.Delay(2000); // Wait for discovery foreach (var radio in API.RadioList) { Console.WriteLine($"Found: {radio.Nickname} ({radio.Model})"); } Remarks This list is automatically populated as radios are discovered via UDP broadcast. Radios that do not send discovery packets for RADIOLIST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS seconds are automatically removed from the list. Subscribe to RadioAdded and RadioRemoved events to be notified when radios are added or removed from this list. Methods CloseSession() Closes the API session and cleans up all resources. public static void CloseSession() Examples try { API.Init(); // Your application code } finally { API.CloseSession(); // Always cleanup } Remarks This method should be called when your application is shutting down. It performs the following: Stops radio discovery Disconnects from all connected radios Removes all radios from the RadioList Releases network resources After calling this method, you can call Init() again to restart the API. See Also Init() Init() Initializes the FlexLib API and starts radio discovery on the network. public static void Init() Examples API.ProgramName = "MyFlexRadioApp"; API.IsGUI = true; // Subscribe to events before Init() to catch all discoveries API.RadioAdded += (radio) => Console.WriteLine($"Found: {radio.Nickname}"); API.Init(); Remarks This method must be called before using any FlexLib functionality. It performs the following: Opens a UDP socket for radio discovery on port 4992 Starts listening for radio discovery broadcasts Initializes the WAN server for remote radio access Starts a cleanup timer to remove stale radios This method is thread-safe and can be called multiple times. Subsequent calls after the first initialization are ignored. ProgramName should be set before calling this method. See Also CloseSession() RadioAdded RadioList Events RadioAdded Occurs when a new FlexRadio device is discovered on the network. public static event API.RadioAddedEventHandler RadioAdded Event Type API.RadioAddedEventHandler Examples API.RadioAdded += (radio) => { Console.WriteLine($"Discovered: {radio.Nickname} at {radio.IP}"); // Optionally connect to the radio if (radio.Available) { radio.Connect(); } }; API.Init(); Remarks This event is fired when a radio sends a discovery packet and is added to the RadioList. The radio is not connected at this point, only discovered. Subscribe to this event before calling Init() to ensure you don't miss any radio discoveries. Event handlers are invoked on a background thread. Use appropriate thread synchronization if updating UI elements. See Also RadioRemoved RadioList RadioChangedIp Occurs when a radio's IP address changes on the network. public static event API.RadioChangedIpEventHandler RadioChangedIp Event Type API.RadioChangedIpEventHandler Examples API.RadioChangedIp += (radio) => { Console.WriteLine($"Radio {radio.Nickname} changed IP to {radio.IP}"); }; Remarks This event is fired when a radio is detected with the same serial number but a different IP address than previously discovered. This can occur when the radio obtains a new DHCP lease or its network configuration changes. RadioRemoved Occurs when a FlexRadio device is removed from the network or times out. public static event API.RadioRemovedEventHandler RadioRemoved Event Type API.RadioRemovedEventHandler Examples API.RadioRemoved += (radio) => { Console.WriteLine($"Lost connection to: {radio.Nickname}"); }; Remarks This event is fired when a radio stops sending discovery packets for RADIOLIST_TIMEOUT_SECONDS seconds, or when the radio is manually removed from the list. Event handlers are invoked on a background thread. See Also RadioAdded WanListReceived Occurs when the list of WAN-accessible radios is received from the WAN server. public static event API.WanListReceivedEventHandler WanListReceived Event Type API.WanListReceivedEventHandler Examples API.WanListReceived += (radios) => { foreach (var radio in radios) { Console.WriteLine($"Remote radio: {radio.Nickname}"); } }; Remarks This event is fired when connecting to a WAN server and receiving the list of remotely accessible radios. Subscribe to this event to be notified of available remote radios.

api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.Meter.html.title: Class Meter | FlexLib API Documentation
api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.Meter.html.summary: Class Meter Namespace Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib Assembly FlexLib.dll Represents a telemetry meter that provides real-time monitoring data from the radio. public class Meter Inheritance object Meter Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Examples // Monitor SWR during transmission radio.MeterAdded += (meter) => { if (meter.Name == "SWR") { meter.DataReady += (data) => { Console.WriteLine($"SWR: {data.Value:F2}:1"); if (data.Value > 3.0) { Console.WriteLine("WARNING: High SWR detected!"); } }; } }; Remarks Meters provide real-time monitoring of various radio parameters including: Signal levels (MICPEAK, COMPPEAK, SIGNAL) Power measurements (FWD, REF, SWR) System status (VOLTAGE, TEMP) Audio levels (LEVELPEAK, LEVELAVG) Meters are automatically created by the radio and added to the Radio.MeterList. Subscribe to the Radio.MeterAdded event to be notified when new meters become available, then subscribe to the meter's DataReady event to receive real-time data updates. Meter data updates are sent at regular intervals (typically 10-50ms depending on the meter type). Event handlers are called on a background thread. Fields SOURCE_AMPLIFIER public const string SOURCE_AMPLIFIER = "AMP" Field Value string SOURCE_SLICE public const string SOURCE_SLICE = "SLC" Field Value string Properties Description public string Description { get; set; } Property Value string FPS public double FPS { get; set; } Property Value double High public double High { get; set; } Property Value double Index public int Index { get; } Property Value int Low public double Low { get; set; } Property Value double Name public string Name { get; set; } Property Value string Peak public bool Peak { get; set; } Property Value bool Source public string Source { get; set; } Property Value string SourceIndex public int SourceIndex { get; set; } Property Value int Units public MeterUnits Units { get; set; } Property Value MeterUnits Methods ToString() Returns a string that represents the current object. public override string ToString() Returns string A string that represents the current object. api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.MeterUnits.h.title: Enum MeterUnits | FlexLib API Documentation
api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.MeterUnits.h.summary: Enum MeterUnits Namespace Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib Assembly FlexLib.dll Specifies the units of measurement for meter values. public enum MeterUnits Fields Amps = 2 Measurement in amperes (A). Db = 3 Measurement in decibels (dB). Dbfs = 4 Measurement in dB relative to full scale (dBFS). Dbm = 5 Measurement in dB relative to 1 milliwatt (dBm). DegreesC = 8 Measurement in degrees Celsius (°C). DegreesF = 7 Measurement in degrees Fahrenheit (°F). None = 0 No units specified. Percent = 11 Measurement as a percentage (%). RPM = 6 Measurement in revolutions per minute (RPM). SWR = 9 Standing Wave Ratio (SWR), a unitless ratio. Volts = 1 Measurement in volts (V). Watts = 10 Measurement in watts (W).

api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.Slice.html.title: Class Slice | FlexLib API Documentation
api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.Slice.html.summary: Class Slice Namespace Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib Assembly FlexLib.dll Represents a receiver/transmitter channel (slice) in a FlexRadio device. public class Slice : ObservableObject, INotifyPropertyChanged Inheritance object ObservableObject Slice Implements INotifyPropertyChanged Inherited Members ObservableObject.PropertyChanged ObservableObject.OnPropertyChanged(PropertyChangedEventArgs) ObservableObject.RaisePropertyChanged<T>(Expression<Func<T>>) ObservableObject.RaisePropertyChanged(string) ObservableObject.VerifyPropertyName(string) object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Examples // Create and configure a slice radio.RequestSliceFromRadio(); await Task.Delay(500); var slice = radio.SliceList.FirstOrDefault(); if (slice != null) { slice.Freq = 14.200; // Tune to 14.200 MHz slice.Mode = "USB"; // Set to Upper Sideband slice.FilterLow = 200; // Set filter low cut slice.FilterHigh = 2800; // Set filter high cut slice.Active = true; // Activate slice } Remarks A slice is an independent receiver or transmitter channel that can be tuned to any frequency within the radio's capabilities. Modern FlexRadio devices support multiple simultaneous slices (typically up to 8), allowing monitoring of different frequencies or modes at the same time. Each slice has its own: Frequency and mode settings Filter configuration Audio gain and routing AGC settings Antenna selection Processing features (NR, NB, ANF, APF) Slices are created by calling Radio.RequestSliceFromRadio and removed with RemoveSlice(Slice). This class implements INotifyPropertyChanged for data binding support. Properties AGCMode Gets or sets the current AGC mode for the Slice. public AGCMode AGCMode { get; set; } Property Value AGCMode AGCOffLevel public int AGCOffLevel { get; set; } Property Value int AGCThreshold public int AGCThreshold { get; set; } Property Value int ANFLOn Enables or disables the lms legacy auto-notch filter (ANFL) for the slice. public bool ANFLOn { get; set; } Property Value bool ANFL_Level Gets or sets the lms legacy auto-notch filter (ANFL) level from 0 to 100 for the slice. public int ANFL_Level { get; set; } Property Value int ANFLevel Gets or sets the auto-notch filter (ANF) level from 0 to 100. public int ANFLevel { get; set; } Property Value int ANFOn Enables or disables the auto-notch filter (ANF) for the Slice. public bool ANFOn { get; set; } Property Value bool ANFTOn Enables or disables FFT-based automatic notch filter (ANFT) for the slice. public bool ANFTOn { get; set; } Property Value bool APFLevel Gets or sets the auto-peaking filter (APF) level from 0 to 100. public int APFLevel { get; set; } Property Value int APFOn Enables or disables the auto-peaking filter (APF) for the Slice. public bool APFOn { get; set; } Property Value bool Active Gets or sets the whether the Slice is the Active Slice. public bool Active { get; set; } Property Value bool AudioGain Sets the Slice audio level from 0 to 100. public int AudioGain { get; set; } Property Value int AudioPan Gets or sets the left-right pan for the Slice audio from 0 to 100. A value of 50 pans evenly between left and right. public int AudioPan { get; set; } Property Value int AutoPan public bool AutoPan { get; set; } Property Value bool ClientHandle public uint ClientHandle { get; } Property Value uint DAXChannel Gets or sets the DAX Channel for the Slice, from 0 to 8 public int DAXChannel { get; set; } Property Value int DFMPreDeEmphasis Gets or sets whether de-emphasis is enabled on RX and if the slice is the transmitter then it also controls pre-emphasis. public bool DFMPreDeEmphasis { get; set; } Property Value bool DIGLOffset Gets or sets the Slice DIGL offset public int DIGLOffset { get; set; } Property Value int DIGUOffset Gets or sets the Slice DIGL offset public int DIGUOffset { get; set; } Property Value int DemodMode public string DemodMode { get; set; } Property Value string DiversityChild Represents if this slice is a diversity child. Only available for 2-SCU radios public bool DiversityChild { get; } Property Value bool DiversityIndex The slice index of the paired diversity slice. public int DiversityIndex { get; } Property Value int DiversityOn Enables or disables the simple Diversity reception for the Slice. Only available for the FLEX-6700 and FLEX-6700R. public bool DiversityOn { get; set; } Property Value bool DiversitySlicePartner The diversity Slice is associated with this Slice, if this Slice is a diversity Slice parent or child. If this Slice is a diversity parent, DiversitySlicePartner will be the diversity child Slice and vice versa. public Slice DiversitySlicePartner { get; } Property Value Slice ESCEnabled public bool ESCEnabled { get; set; } Property Value bool ESCGain public double ESCGain { get; set; } Property Value double ESCPhaseShift public double ESCPhaseShift { get; set; } Property Value double EqCompBypass public bool EqCompBypass { get; set; } Property Value bool FMDeviation Controls the FM deviation for a given slice. If the slice is also the transmitter it updates the transmit FM deviation as well. public int FMDeviation { get; set; } Property Value int FMRepeaterOffsetFreq Gets or sets the OffsetFrequency used for transmitting a wide split in FM. public double FMRepeaterOffsetFreq { get; set; } Property Value double FMTX1750 Gets or sets whether the FM 1750 Hz PL tone is enabled (EU only) public bool FMTX1750 { get; set; } Property Value bool FMToneValue Used to set the value of the FM Tone. In most cases this is the repeater tone.S public string FMToneValue { get; set; } Property Value string FilterHigh Gets or sets the Slice receive filter high cut in Hz public int FilterHigh { get; set; } Property Value int FilterLow Gets or sets the Slice receive filter low cut in Hz public int FilterLow { get; set; } Property Value int Freq Gets or sets the frequency of the slice in megahertz (MHz). public double Freq { get; set; } Property Value double The frequency in MHz. Valid range depends on radio model and configuration, typically from 0.03 MHz to 77 MHz (direct sampling) and 122.88 MHz to 245.76 MHz. Examples // Tune to 14.200 MHz (20m band) slice.Freq = 14.200; // Tune to 146.52 MHz (2m simplex) slice.Freq = 146.52; // Monitor frequency changes slice.PropertyChanged += (s, e) => { if (e.PropertyName == "Freq") Console.WriteLine($"Now tuned to: {slice.Freq:F6} MHz"); }; Remarks Setting this property sends a command to the radio to tune the slice to the specified frequency. The actual tuned frequency may differ slightly due to radio hardware constraints. If the slice is locked (Lock is true), setting this property has no effect. This property raises PropertyChanged when the frequency changes. See Also Lock Index Gets the slice index of the Slice. public int Index { get; } Property Value int IsTransmitSlice public bool IsTransmitSlice { get; set; } Property Value bool Letter public string Letter { get; } Property Value string Lock Gets or sets whether or not the Slice is locked. When locked, the Slice frequency cannot be changed. public bool Lock { get; set; } Property Value bool LoopA public bool LoopA { get; set; } Property Value bool LoopB public bool LoopB { get; set; } Property Value bool MaxInternalPaPowerWatts public int MaxInternalPaPowerWatts { get; set; } Property Value int ModeList A list of available modes for this slice public List<string> ModeList { get; set; } Property Value List<string> Mute Gets or sets the mute state of the Slice. When true, the Slice audio is muted. public bool Mute { get; set; } Property Value bool NBLevel Gets or sets the Noise Blanker (NB) level from 0 to 100. public int NBLevel { get; set; } Property Value int NBOn Enables or disables the Noise Blanker (NB) for the Slice. public bool NBOn { get; set; } Property Value bool NRFLevel Gets or sets Noise Reduction w/ filter (NRF) level from 0 to 100 for the slice. public int NRFLevel { get; set; } Property Value int NRFOn Enables or disables Noise Reduction w/ Filter (NRF, better NR) for the slice. public bool NRFOn { get; set; } Property Value bool NRLOn Enables or disables the lms legacy noise reduction (NRL) for the slice. public bool NRLOn { get; set; } Property Value bool NRL_Level Gets or sets the lms legacy Noise Reduction (NRL) level from 0 to 100 for the slice. public int NRL_Level { get; set; } Property Value int NRLevel Gets or sets the Noise Reduction (NR) level from 0 to 100 for the Slice. public int NRLevel { get; set; } Property Value int NROn Enables or disables the Noise Reduction (NR) for the Slice. public bool NROn { get; set; } Property Value bool NRSLevel Gets or sets spectral subtraction noise reduction (NRS) level from 0 to 100 of the slice. public int NRSLevel { get; set; } Property Value int NRSOn Enables or disables spectral subtraction noise reduction (NRS) for the slice. public bool NRSOn { get; set; } Property Value bool Owner public string Owner { get; set; } Property Value string Panadapter Gets the Panadapter object that the Slice is associated with. public Panadapter Panadapter { get; } Property Value Panadapter PanadapterStreamID Gets the Stream ID of the Panadapter object that the Slice is associated with. public uint PanadapterStreamID { get; } Property Value uint PlayEnabled Enables or disables the play button for the Slice public bool PlayEnabled { get; } Property Value bool PlayOn Enables or disables audio recording playback for the Slice. public bool PlayOn { get; set; } Property Value bool QSK public bool QSK { get; } Property Value bool RFGain Sets the RF gain for the SCU on which this Slice is on (-10, 0 , 10, 20, 30) [Obsolete("This property is no longer used. Use the RFGain property in Panadapter.cs instead.")] public int RFGain { get; set; } Property Value int RITFreq public int RITFreq { get; set; } Property Value int RITOn public bool RITOn { get; set; } Property Value bool RNNOn Enables or disables AI noise reduction (RNN) for the slice. public bool RNNOn { get; set; } Property Value bool RTTYMark Gets or sets the Slice RTTY Mark offset public int RTTYMark { get; set; } Property Value int RTTYShift Gets or sets the Slice RTTY Shift offset public int RTTYShift { get; set; } Property Value int RXAnt Gets or sets the receive antenna for the slice as a string: "ANT1", "ANT2", "RX_A", "RX_B", "XVTR" public string RXAnt { get; set; } Property Value string RXAntList A list of the available RX Antenna ports on the radio, i.e. "ANT1", "ANT2", "RX_A", "RX_B", "XVTR" public string[] RXAntList { get; } Property Value string[] Radio public Radio Radio { get; } Property Value Radio RecordOn Enables or disables audio recording for the Slice. public bool RecordOn { get; set; } Property Value bool RepeaterOffsetDirection Gets or sets the direction that the TX Offset will be applied in. public FMTXOffsetDirection RepeaterOffsetDirection { get; set; } Property Value FMTXOffsetDirection SquelchLevel Gets or sets the squelch level for modes with squelch. 0 - 100 is valid. public int SquelchLevel { get; set; } Property Value int SquelchOn Gets or sets whether the squelch algorithm is on for a given slice. public bool SquelchOn { get; set; } Property Value bool TXAnt Gets or sets the transmit antenna for the slice as a string: "ANT1", "ANT2", "XVTR" public string TXAnt { get; set; } Property Value string TXAntList A list of the available RX Antenna ports on the radio, i.e. "ANT1", "ANT2", "RX_A", "RX_B", "XVTR" public string[] TXAntList { get; } Property Value string[] TXOffsetFreq Gets or sets the offset frequency of the transmitter. public double TXOffsetFreq { get; set; } Property Value double ToneMode public FMToneMode ToneMode { get; set; } Property Value FMToneMode TuneStep public int TuneStep { get; set; } Property Value int TuneStepList public int[] TuneStepList { get; set; } Property Value int[] WNBLevel Gets or sets the Wideband Noise Blanker (WNB) level from 0 to 100. public int WNBLevel { get; set; } Property Value int WNBOn Enables or disables the Wideband Noise Blanker (WNB) for the Slice. public bool WNBOn { get; set; } Property Value bool Wide Gets the 'wide' state of the radio, if applicable. When true, the receive preselector filters in the radio are bypassed. public bool Wide { get; } Property Value bool XITFreq public int XITFreq { get; set; } Property Value int XITOn public bool XITOn { get; set; } Property Value bool Methods CheckReady() public void CheckReady() Close() public void Close() FindMeterByIndex(int) public Meter FindMeterByIndex(int index) Parameters index int Returns Meter FindMeterByName(string) public Meter FindMeterByName(string s) Parameters s string Returns Meter Remove() [Obsolete] public void Remove() SendCWAutotuneCommand(bool?) public void SendCWAutotuneCommand(bool? isIntermittent) Parameters isIntermittent bool? api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.Spot.html.title: Class Spot | FlexLib API Documentation
api/Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib.Spot.html.summary: Class Spot Namespace Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib Assembly FlexLib.dll public class Spot : ObservableObject, INotifyPropertyChanged Inheritance object ObservableObject Spot Implements INotifyPropertyChanged Inherited Members ObservableObject.PropertyChanged ObservableObject.OnPropertyChanged(PropertyChangedEventArgs) ObservableObject.RaisePropertyChanged<T>(Expression<Func<T>>) ObservableObject.RaisePropertyChanged(string) ObservableObject.VerifyPropertyName(string) object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors Spot() This constructor is intended to be used to populate a Spot object prior to requesting it from the radio using the Radio.RequestSpot function. Note that the resulting status messages from the radio will create a new Spot object that contains a Radio reference and an index. public Spot() Fields _rxFrequency public double _rxFrequency Field Value double _txFrequency public double _txFrequency Field Value double Properties BackgroundColor (Optional). A color represented by hex. Typical format #AARRGGBB public string BackgroundColor { get; set; } Property Value string Callsign The Callsign to display for the Spot (dxcall in N1MM spot packet) public string Callsign { get; set; } Property Value string Color (Optional). A color represented by hex. Typical format #AARRGGBB public string Color { get; set; } Property Value string Comment The Spot comment as provided by the original Spot source. public string Comment { get; set; } Property Value string Index The radio's reference to spot object. When this is -1, it is assumed that the FlexLib object exists only on the client side (as opposed to a Spot object about which the radio is aware. public int Index { get; } Property Value int LifetimeSeconds An expiration time. After this many seconds, the Spot will automatically be removed from the radio. Setting this property will reset the countdown timer. Warning: Because duplicate values are allowed to "reset" this timer, care should be taken in the client not to create a loop where an upstream PropertyChanged event triggers a downstream Property set call (which calls the radio, which generates a status message, which creates another PropertyChanged event...). public int LifetimeSeconds { get; set; } Property Value int Mode The Mode specified for the Spot. Note that this may not always be provided and may not map directly to a DSPMode (e.g. SSB, PSK31, etc) public string Mode { get; set; } Property Value string Priority The integer (1:higher-5:lower) priority of the Spot perhaps due to multipliers, etc. Higher priority Spots will be shown lower on the Panadapter. public int Priority { get; set; } Property Value int RXFrequency The frequency to be used to place the Spot. If no TXFrequency is set, this is the assumed TX Frequency (simplex). public double RXFrequency { get; set; } Property Value double Source A string used to identify from where the Spot came. For example, the source will be N1MM-[StationName] for spots that originate from N1MMSpot Ports. public string Source { get; set; } Property Value string SpotterCallsign The callsign of the spotter as is often reported on telnet. public string SpotterCallsign { get; set; } Property Value string TXFrequency (optional) This field would indicate a Split spot with a different transmit frequency than the RX frequency. When this field is blank, it is assumed to be a simplex Spot where the TX Frequency matches the RX Frequency. Note that triggering a Spot with this field set does not automatically create a Split Slice as of v2.3.x. public double TXFrequency { get; set; } Property Value double Timestamp The timestamp (UTC) of the spot as reported by the original source public DateTime Timestamp { get; set; } Property Value DateTime TriggerAction The action for the radio to take when a Spot is triggered (clicked in SmartSDR). The supported actions today are "tune" and "none". The assumption is that a client that sets a Spot to "none" will likely be implementing their own functionality that tuning might interfere with. public string TriggerAction { get; set; } Property Value string Methods Remove() Removes a spot from the radio. Note that only upon the resulting status message from the radio will the SpotRemoved event fire from the Radio object. public void Remove() Trigger() A parameterless version of the Spot Trigger public void Trigger() Trigger(Panadapter) Gets called when the Spot is interacted with (e.g. Clicked in SmartSDR) and could be called to simulate a Spot being Clicked. public void Trigger(Panadapter pan) Parameters pan Panadapter A reference to the Panadapter to use for any actions like tuning.

The data binding engine calls this method when it propagates the values from source bindings to the binding target. public object Convert(object[] values, Type targetType, object parameter, CultureInfo culture) Parameters values object[] The array of values that the source bindings in the MultiBinding produces. The value UnsetValue indicates that the source binding has no value to provide for conversion. targetType Type The type of the binding target property. parameter object The converter parameter to use. culture CultureInfo The culture to use in the converter. Returns object A converted value. If the method returns null, the valid null value is used. A return value of DependencyProperty.UnsetValue indicates that the converter did not produce a value, and that the binding will use the FallbackValue if it is available, or else will use the default value. A return value of Binding.DoNothing indicates that the binding does not transfer the value or use the FallbackValue or the default value. ConvertBack(object, Type[], object, CultureInfo) Converts a binding target value to the source binding values. public object[] ConvertBack(object value, Type[] targetTypes, object parameter, CultureInfo culture) Parameters value object The value that the binding target produces. targetTypes Type[] The array of types to convert to. The array length indicates the number and types of values that are suggested for the method to return. parameter object The converter parameter to use. culture CultureInfo The culture to use in the converter. Returns object[] An array of values that have been converted from the target value back to the source values.

api/Flex.Util.WaterfallTile.html.title: Class WaterfallTile | FlexLib API Documentation
api/Flex.Util.WaterfallTile.html.summary: Class WaterfallTile Namespace Flex.Util Assembly Util.dll public class WaterfallTile Inheritance object WaterfallTile Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Fields Data The waterfall bin data public ushort[] Data Field Value ushort[] FirstBinIndex The index of the first bin in the tile. If a full frame was split across multiple packets/tiles, this would tell you which set of data it represented in the frame. For example, if a Frame had 1300 bins in it, it could get split across 3 packets/tiles. These tiles might have FirstBinIndex values of 0, 500, and 1000 (last packet containing only 300 bins). Note that the Timecode and FrameLowFreq would be the same for all 3 of these packets. public uint FirstBinIndex Field Value uint TotalBinsInFrame The total number of FFT points (bins) in the frame. Note that if the data was split across multiple packets, this number may not match the length of the Data field public uint TotalBinsInFrame Field Value uint Properties AutoBlackLevel The level to use if Auto Black is enabled (for automatically setting the 'noise floor' of the display) public uint AutoBlackLevel { get; set; } Property Value uint BinBandwidth The "width" represented by each Bin. For example, a 1MHz waterfall display with 4096 bins would have a BinBandwidth of ~244Hz. public VitaFrequency BinBandwidth { get; set; } Property Value VitaFrequency DateTime The arrival timestamp of the packet (UTC) public DateTime DateTime { get; set; } Property Value DateTime FrameLowFreq The frequency represented by the first bin in the frame (note: the frame could be spread across multiple packets feeding this object) public VitaFrequency FrameLowFreq { get; set; } Property Value VitaFrequency Height The number of bins tall described by the tile public ushort Height { get; set; } Property Value ushort IsFrameComplete If the WaterfallTile is spread across multiple packets, this property will be false until a complete frames data has arrived public bool IsFrameComplete { get; set; } Property Value bool LineDurationMS The length of time represented by the tile in milliseconds. Faster update rates will result in lower line durations. For example, a rate that yields 10 frames per second would have a line duration of 100ms. A faster rate might yield 20 frames per second and would have a duration of 50ms. public uint LineDurationMS { get; set; } Property Value uint Timecode An index relating the Tile to a relative time base public uint Timecode { get; set; } Property Value uint Width The number of bins wide described by the tile public ushort Width { get; set; } Property Value ushort Methods ToString() Returns a string that represents the current object. public override string ToString() Returns string A string that represents the current object.

index.html.title: FlexLib API Documentation | FlexLib API Documentation
index.html.summary: FlexLib API Documentation Welcome to the FlexLib API Documentation - your comprehensive guide to developing applications for FlexRadio Systems software-defined radios. What is FlexLib? FlexLib is a powerful C# library that provides complete control over FlexRadio devices. Whether you're building a simple radio controller or a sophisticated SDR application, FlexLib offers the tools you need. 📚 Documentation Sections Getting Started New to FlexLib? Start here! This guide walks you through: Setting up your development environment Your first FlexLib application Basic radio control concepts Common patterns and practices API Reference Detailed documentation for every class, method, and property in FlexLib: API Class - Initialize and discover radios Radio Class - Control radio operations Slice Class - Manage receiver/transmitter slices Audio Streams - Handle audio data And much more... Examples Real-world code examples showing: Radio discovery and connection Frequency control and mode selection Audio streaming Meter monitoring Multi-radio applications Architecture Deep dive into FlexLib's design: System architecture overview Component relationships Threading model Network protocol details Best practices Migration Guide Upgrading from a previous version? Find: Breaking changes New features Deprecated APIs Migration strategies 🚀 Quick Links Task Link Connect to a radio Getting Started - Connection Create a slice API Reference - Radio.RequestSliceFromRadio Stream audio Examples - Audio Streaming Handle meters Examples - Meter Monitoring Transmit control Getting Started - PTT Control 💡 Key Concepts Radio Discovery FlexLib automatically discovers FlexRadio devices on your network using UDP broadcasting. Simply call API.Init() and listen for discovered radios. Event-Driven Architecture FlexLib uses C# events extensively. Subscribe to events like RadioAdded, SliceAdded, PropertyChanged to respond to radio state changes. Command-Response Protocol Communication with the radio uses a text-based command protocol. FlexLib handles this automatically, but understanding it helps with debugging. VITA-49 Streaming Audio and IQ data use the VITA-49 packet protocol for high-performance streaming. FlexLib abstracts this complexity while providing low-level access when needed. 🎯 Common Use Cases Desktop Applications Build full-featured radio control applications with: Multiple panadapter displays Slice management Audio routing Logging and spotting Headless Controllers Create server-based applications for: Remote operation Automated monitoring Digital mode gateways Contest logging servers Integration Projects Integrate FlexRadio with: Station automation systems Rotator controllers Amplifier interfaces Custom hardware 🔧 System Requirements .NET Framework 4.6.2 or .NET 8.0 Windows 10/11 (x86, x64, ARM64) FlexRadio device on the same network Visual Studio 2022 (for development) 📦 Dependencies FlexLib requires these NuGet packages: AsyncAwaitBestPractices (v9.0.0) DotNetZip (v1.16.0) Newtonsoft.Json (v13.0.3) System.Collections.Immutable (v9.0.0) 🆘 Need Help?
